head.title: Choices for the New York Primary

hedline.hl1: Choices for the New York Primary

abstract.p: Editorial endorsements in New York State primary for US House: Republican Joan Johnson and Democrat Steven Israel in Second Congressional District; Democrat Anthony Weiner in Ninth Congressional District; Democrat Barry Ford in 10th District; Democrat Major Owen in 11th District; Democrat Eliot Engel in 17th District; endorsements for State Senate: Democrat Liz Krueger in 26th District; Democrat Felix Rosado in 28th District; Democrat Ruth Hassell-Thompson in 33d District; Democrat Lorraine Coyle Koppell in 34th District; State Assembly: Democrat Kimon Thermos in 37th District; Democrat Catherine Nolan in 37th District; Democrat Martin Malave-Dilan in 54th District; Democrat Raymond Jorgensen in 59th District; Democrat Nelson Denis in 68th District; Civil Court: Democrat Barbara Jaffe in First District; Democrat Maxine Archer in Seventh District (M)

block.p: New York State's primary today gives voters a chance to pick party candidates for the Nov. 7 election. Because of low voter turnout in the past, some races, even for Congress, have been won by margins of only a few hundred votes. Here are our choices in 18 contested primaries, one Republican and the rest Democratic. These choices do not imply endorsement in the general election. The polls will be open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m.

New York State's primary today gives voters a chance to pick party candidates for the Nov. 7 election. Because of low voter turnout in the past, some races, even for Congress, have been won by margins of only a few hundred votes. Here are our choices in 18 contested primaries, one Republican and the rest Democratic. These choices do not imply endorsement in the general election. The polls will be open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m.

Suffolk County, Second District: Joan Johnson (R); Steven Israel (D). Brooklyn and Queens, Ninth District: Anthony Weiner (D). Brooklyn, 10th District: Barry Ford (D); 11th District: Major Owens (D). The Bronx and Westchester, 17th District: Eliot Engel (D).

Manhattan, 26th District: Liz Krueger (D). Manhattan and the Bronx, 28th District: Felix Rosado (D). The Bronx and Westchester, 33rd District: Ruth Hassell-Thompson (D); 34th District: Lorraine Coyle Koppell (D).

Queens, 36th District: Kimon Thermos (D); 37th District: Catherine Nolan (D). Brooklyn, 54th District: Martin Malave-Dilan (D); 57th District: Roger Green (D). Staten Island, 59th District: Raymond Jorgensen (D). Manhattan, 68th District: Nelson Denis (D).
Manhattan, First District: Barbara Jaffe (D). Brooklyn, Seventh District: Maxine Archer (D).
